result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. JB Richmond Jr

records.addlTxt:
10:08 AM Defendant JB Richmond Jr in court.  Prosecuting attorney Frank John Remington in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has not yet obtained counsel, requested adjournment to retain private counsel. State requested case be scheduled for Preliminary Hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 17, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

2:17 PM Defendant JB Richmond Jr in court.  Prosecuting attorney Thersa Louise Lewandowski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has SPD on other cases and was under the understanding that attorney would just be appointed on this case.  He was instructed to go to SPD and apply for this case to have Atty Woodard appointed on this case also.
Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on October 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on September 12, 2022 at 01:40 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 7

11:01 AM Defendant appeared.  Thersa Louise Lewandowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:40 pm.
